Question.Subject: Why do I always have to refresh my web pages for updated page?
Question.Content: I have Windows Vista and lately I have to clik on refresh to get the updated page. Even in Ebay I have to refresh old pages whether I log on using favorites or use the web bar. Even when i reboot, I log into yahoo and have to refresh the page every time. I don't remember changing any configuration.
Question.ChosenAnswer: i think that your browser is set to cache web pages, you can set the browser to always load the page from scratch. i think that browsers are set to load cached pages to speed up browsing, so if you have already been to a web page it does not have to load all the files again every time. most sites are only updated every few days anyway, so it would normally not effect you.

Answer.Content: You always have to hit refresh to refresh a page, That is what the refresh button is for.
